result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

14CF300 & 301 - Defendant Cori S. Smith in court, in custody with attorney Annamarie Amy Wineke.  Kurt Frederich Klomberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Wineke heard on Bond Motion. DA Klomberg heard. Court heard and denies motion.
Copy of notice of hearing for 9/25/15 sent to jail
Motion hearing at 09-25-2015 09:15 am
Notice of motion and order for furlough
and order for furlough
Sentencing hearing at 08-20-2015 03:00 pm

14CF300 & 14CF301 - Defendant Cori S. Smith in court with attorney Annamarie Amy Wineke.  Kurt Frederich Klomberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Wineke is not contesting state's motion to revoke DPA;  court orders DPA revoked.  Atty Klomberg heard;  request $2,500 cash bail and PSI, will be recommending a lengthy prison sentence.  Atty Wineke responds.  

Court heard;  revokes DPA, accepts plea and orders judgment of conviction be entered.  Court sets cash bail at $2,500 w/all prior conditions;  PSI ordered.  Defendant taken into custody. Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 20, 2015 at 03:00 pm.

to revoke Deferred prosecution Agreement

14CF300, 301 Defendant Cori S. Smith in court with attorney Annamarie Amy Wineke.  Kurt Frederich Klomberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court reviews charges and penalties, defendant pleads guilty to ct. 1 in 14CF301, court finds plea made FVKI, court accepts plea and finds def guilty, court accepts the defendant into the TAD program. 14CF300 is DRI, 14CF301 cts. 2-4 are DRI, court heard.
Status conference on April 2, 2015 at 01:00 pm.

Case called along with 14CF301.  Defendant Cori S. Smith in court with attorney Annamarie Amy Wineke.   Gilbert Thompson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court questioned attorney as to why there was a missed appearance for the TSC. She stated she was in court and unable to make the call.  Attorney reported that her client has completed his assessment.  TAD counselors appeared in court to verify that.  The State requested Motions in Limine be scheduled, case to be set for an IPSTC.
Status conference on February 20, 2015 at 09:30 am.
on Arraignment

14CF300 & 14CF301: Defendant Cori S. Smith in court, in custody with attorney Annamarie A. Wineke.  Kurt Frederich Klomberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin. This is bail review hearing to reduce cash; Atty. Winke heard on bond request - Def. is TAD eligible and has had his assessment done; State heard - will not oppose modification to PA bond w/conditions: Def. must live at Father's residence, no drugs, etc.; original bond conditions; Court grants the request - to $2500 PA BOND: Reside with Father at 212 Grove Street, #3, Beaver Dam, WI; Not use/possess drugs w/o prescription; all other conditions still apply; one bond for both cases; Def. remanded

14CF300, 301 Defendant, Cori S. Smith in court, Robert G. Barrington appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant would like to get his own attorney, Atty Barrington heard, court finds defendant isn't making a diligent effort to obtain an attorney, court tells defendant to report to the SPD office.  Court makes defendant report to the jail for a urinalysis.  Court schedules review hearing.  Review hearing scheduled for November 19, 2014 at 08:15 am.

Defendant shall not use/possess/control any controlled substances (without a valid prescription therefore) or drug paraphernalia, nor be in the presence of anyone who does.  Defendant shall have his/her fingerprints and photographs taken at the Dodge County Sheriff's Department, Jail Division.

9:10 - 14CF300 & 301 - Defendant, Cori S. Smith in court, Yolanda J. Tienstra appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant has received copy of Criminal Complaint and advised of rights, charges, penalties and right to Preliminary Hearing. Court finds probable cause. New address given: 5113 Highcrest Rd, Rockford, IL 61108. Prelim requested waiving time limits. Prelim & Review set. Court sets bond at $2500 PA bond  with conditions:   Defendant shall have his/her fingerprints and photographs taken at the Dodge County Sheriff's Department, Jail Division.  Defendant shall not use/possess/control any controlled substances (without a valid prescription therefore) or drug paraphernalia, nor be in the presence of anyone who does.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for November 20, 2014 at 01:30 pm.  Review hearing scheduled for October 29, 2014 at 08:15 am.
